alerts.message:
...Red flag warning in effect from 4 PM MDT /3 PM PDT/ this
afternoon to midnight MDT /11 PM PDT/ tonight for lightning for
Burns blm and Vale blm...which are fire weather zones 636 and
637...

.Thunderstorms expected to move out of northern California this
afternoon and move into southeast Oregon. 

The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a red flag
warning for lightning...which is in effect from 4 PM MDT /3 PM
PDT/ this afternoon to midnight MDT /11 PM PDT/ tonight. 

* Thunderstorms...scattered thunderstorms developing this
 afternoon

* outflow winds...gusts up to 50 mph possible. 

Precautionary/preparedness actions...

A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions
are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of
strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can
contribute to extreme fire behavior.

...Rip current risk now in effect through this evening...

* timing...through 8 PM today.

* Impacts...more frequent rip currents may pull even strong 
 swimmers out into deeper waters. 

Precautionary/preparedness actions...

There is a moderate risk of rip currents along the beaches of
Pinellas...Hillsborough...Manatee...Sarasota...Charlotte and Lee
counties through this evening.

Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away
from shore...which occur most often at low spots or breaks in The
Sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as groins...
jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards and the beach
patrol. Pay attention to flags and posted signs.

If you become caught in a rip current...do not panic. Remain calm
and begin to swim parallel to shore. Once you are away from the
force of the rip current...begin to swim back to the beach. Do
not attempt to swim directly against a rip current. Even a strong
swimmer can become exhausted quickly.




Http://www.Weather.Gov/Tampa
